name: EOD Regional Nodes
title: EOD Regional Nodes
notes:
**Note 1:** Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS in this field. Distant nodes are coded in EOD Mets.

**Note 2:** Pericholedochal nodes are coded in EOD Mets for jejunum and ileum primaries.
footnotes:
(1) Fritz AG, Ries LAG (eds). **SEER Extent of Disease 1988: Codes and Coding Instructions (3rd Edition, 1998)**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 98-2313, Bethesda, MD, 1998

(2) Young JL Jr, Roffers SD, Ries LAG, Fritz AG, Hurlbut AA (eds.). **SEER Summary Staging Manual-2000: Codes and Coding Instructions**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 01-4969, Bethesda, MD, 2001.

(3) Collaborative Stage Work Group of the American Joint Committee on Cancer. **Collaborative Stage Data Collection System User Documentation and Coding Instructions, version 02.05**. American Joint Committee on Cancer (Chicago, IL)

(4) Gress, D.M., Edge, S.B., Gershenwald, J.E., et al. **Principles of Cancer Staging**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017: 3-30

(5) Coit, D.G., Kelsen, D., Hofstetter, W.L., et al. **Small Intestine**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017: 221-234
rows:
Duodenum (C170)
- Duodenal
- Gastroduodenal
- Hepatic 
- Pancreaticoduodenal (inferior)
- Pericholodochal (common bile duct)
- Pyloric (infrapyloric, subpyloric, NOS)
- Retropancreatic
- Superior mesenteric

Jejunum and ileum (C171, C172)
- Cecal (anterior, posterior, retrocecal) (terminal ileum only)
- Ileocecal (ileocolic) (terminal ileum only)
- Mesenteric, NOS
- Superior mesenteric

Regional lymph node(s), NOS
Lymph node(s), NOS

Unknown; regional lymph node(s) not stated
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record

Death Certificate Only
